intro: Bistorta paleacea, commonly known as pale lady's mantle, is a perennial herb native to northern regions of North America. It belongs to the Polygonaceae family, which includes plants like buckwheat and sorrel. The plant is characterized by its basal rosette of thick, waxy leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It produces upright flowering stems topped with clusters of small, greenish-white flowers. Bistorta paleacea is adapted to moist, shaded environments and is often found in wetlands and along stream banks.
